isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - WATER PUMP AND THERMOSTAT - WATER PUMP AND THERMOSTAT - INSPECTION

step1.para: The water pump should be visually inspected for damaged impeller, cracks and other faulty conditions. If any defects are noted, the water pump must be replaced as an assembly.

note.para: Order water pump package and follow instructions included in the package.

step1.para: Inspect the thermostat for proper type (correct design) and temperature range.

important.para: WHEN SERVICING THE THERMOSTAT IT IS ESSENTIAL THAT THE THERMOSTAT OPENS FULLY UPON TEMPERATURE DEMAND TO AVOID AN OVERHEATING CONDITION WHICH MAY CAUSE PREMATURE CYLINDER HEAD GASKET FAILURE.

caution.para: AFTER MARKET "WILL FIT" THERMOSTATS MAY NOT FULLY OPEN DUE TO A FLAT WASHER SECURED TO THE END OF THE POWER PILL WHICH OBSTRUCTS THE BY-PASS AND NORMAL COOLANT FLOW. AN ADDITIONAL DISADVANTAGE IS THEIR OMISSION OF THE RUBBER SLEEVE WHICH PROVIDES THE POSITIVE SEAL. ONLY GENUINE INTERNATIONAL(r) THERMOSTATS ASSURE THE PROPER COOLANT FLOW AND POSITIVE SEALING CHARACTERISTICS REQUIRED TO PROVIDE LONG ENGINE LIFE (FIGURE 7.8 shows acceptable vs. unacceptable).

step1.para:
Check thermostat operation as follows: (Refer to Figure 7.9
).

caution.para: EXERCISE CAUTION AND GOOD JUDGEMENT TO AVOID INJURY WHEN DEALING WITH HOT WATER AND OBJECTS DURING THE THERMOSTAT OPERATION CHECK. USE HEAT RESISTANT GLOVES AND WEAR APPROPRIATE EYE PROTECTION.

step2.para: Manually open the thermostat enough to insert a nylon ribbon under the valve seat. Suspend the thermostat in the container so the thermostat does not touch the bottom of the container.

Heat the container filled with water to the " START-TO-OPEN" temperature of the thermostat (192° F ± 5° ). Observe the thermometer and record the temperature as soon as the thermostat drops from the nylon ribbon. THIS READING IS THE "START TO OPEN" TEMPERATURE.

Continue to heat water to "FULL-OPEN" temperature of 212° F (100° C). Observe the thermometer and movement of thermostat sleeve. Observe thermostat sleeve movement when "FULL-OPEN" temperature is achieved. Minimum sleeve travel at "FULL-OPEN" temperature is 0.26 inches (6.35 mm). Refer to Figure 7.10
.
Remove the thermostat from the water and while the sleeve is off its seat, inspect the seat area for pitting and foreign deposits.
Replace the thermostat if it does not operate as described or meet the visual inspection criteria.
